name: part_004
file: tmp_【3D重大告知】VTuber人生を教科書にして #しくじりかなたそ 先生爆誕！！【天音かなた⧸ホロライブ】 [fm9yOM9knZo]_gemini-3-flash-preview/reencoded/part_004.mov

scenes.description: Amane Kanata introduces her listeners' reactions to her membership name candidates.
A montage of harsh listener reactions to the membership name candidates is shown while the speakers laugh and comment.
Kanata summarizes that listeners were too conflicted to even vote due to the poor naming sense.
Kanata mentions the hashtag "#KanataStopIt" trended in Japan because of her naming sense.
Ririka finds the trending hashtag embarrassing.
Kanata prepares to show the results of the Twitter poll for the membership name.
The poll results are shown, with "THE Kanata" winning, though Ririka notes the choices were all similar.
Kanata explains it was a very close battle that led to the name "THE Kanata."
Kanata admits she eventually realized "THE Kanata" was also tacky.
Kanata explains she noticed the tackiness after seeing other members' stylish membership names.
Kanata announces the current membership name is "Heimin" (Commoners).
Ririka and others react with relief, which Kanata finds unfortunate.
Ririka asks if Kanata's reputation for extreme strength was there from the beginning.
Kanata clarifies that mentioning her strength in introductions started partway through her career.
Kanata explains how her "Grip Strength Gorilla" character became established after she shared stories of her strength.
Kanata introduces a list of things she has accidentally crushed.
A list of destroyed items is displayed on-screen while Kanata reads them out.
Kanata shares a story about accidentally crushing a macaron while trying to hold it gently.
Lamy expresses how much she loves the macaron story.
Lamy begins telling a story about the time Kanata broke a spoon during one of Lamy's projects.
Lamy and Kanata recount how the spoon snapped while Kanata was eating normally.
Ririka jokingly asks if Kanata uses stone spoons at home.
Kanata explains she uses disposable chopsticks but even those break sometimes.
Kanata mentions that the "spoon snapping" incident has happened twice in the dressing room.
Okayu introduces the results of a recent stream where Kanata's grip strength was measured.
The result of 55.9kg is revealed, shocking the other members.
Kanata explains she set a new record while drinking on stream to see if her limiter was off.
Kanata compares her record to Yoshida Saori's 55kg measurement on TV.
Ririka is amazed that Kanata surpassed Yoshida Saori's record.
Kanata challenges Ririka to a handshake; Ririka reveals her grip strength is only 7kg.
Kanata and Ririka engage in a lopsided handshake battle.
Ririka screams in pain as Kanata applies her strength.
Kanata tries to teach Ririka how to apply power, while Lamy pleads for her to stop.
Lamy checks on Ririka, and Kanata remarks that she almost broke Ririka's arm.
Kanata notes that many Hololive members are weak, making her seem like the strange one.
Kanata transitions to discussing a turning point that led to her "Tsukkomi" character.
Kanata tells the story of building a castle in Minecraft that Flare mistook for a school.
Kanata describes how she began playing the straight man to Flare and Miko's school jokes.
Kanata concludes that she realized Hololive is full of people who play the "funny/stupid" role.

subtitles.original: はい、このリスナーさんのね、反応がこちら！
subtitles.english: Yes, here are the reactions from the listeners!

subtitles.original: 全部ダサいってすごい
subtitles.english: It's amazing how they're all tacky.

subtitles.original: ここまで悩むアンケートは初めて
subtitles.english: This is the first time I've ever struggled this much with a poll.

subtitles.original: センスが息をしていない
subtitles.english: Her sense of style is dead.

subtitles.original: ボロクソやん！
subtitles.english: They're trash-talking me!

subtitles.original: 厳しいなー
subtitles.english: That's harsh.

subtitles.original: 悩んでアンケート入れられないと。
subtitles.english: They can't even vote because they're struggling too much.

subtitles.original: なるほどねー。
subtitles.english: I see.

subtitles.original: ネーミングセンスがダサすぎたということで、この時「#かなたやめろ」のハッシュタグがつけられ、
subtitles.english: Because my naming sense was so tacky, the hashtag #KanataStopIt was used,

subtitles.original: なんと日本のトレンドに入ります！
subtitles.english: and it actually trended in Japan!

subtitles.original: すごい！
subtitles.english: Amazing!

subtitles.original: だめだよと、恥ずかしいな。
subtitles.english: No way, that's embarrassing.

subtitles.original: おかしいでしょ。でもどの名前が良いかなって当時のね、Twitterで投票してもらったんですけど、その結果がこうなります。
subtitles.english: That's weird. But I asked people on Twitter back then to vote for which name was best, and this was the result.

subtitles.original: （ドラムロール）
subtitles.english: (Drum roll)

subtitles.original: 「THEかなた」が選ばれたと。
subtitles.english: "THE Kanata" was chosen.

subtitles.original: おお、でもなんか全部ほぼ一緒で、みんな悩んでる。
subtitles.english: Oh, but they're all almost the same, everyone's struggling.

subtitles.original: ちょっとね、僅差なの。
subtitles.english: It was a small difference.

subtitles.original: 大接戦の末、「THEかなた」に決定したんですよね。
subtitles.english: After a close battle, it was decided on "THE Kanata."

subtitles.original: 悩んだだろうな、これみんな。
subtitles.english: Everyone must have struggled with this.

subtitles.original: そう、みんな悩みましたね。
subtitles.english: Yeah, everyone struggled.

subtitles.original: 結局時を経て、去年あたりですかね、「THEかなた」がダサいことに私は気づきました。
subtitles.english: Eventually, as time passed, maybe around last year, I realized that "THE Kanata" was tacky.

subtitles.original: あ、気づきを得た！
subtitles.english: Oh, she gained an insight!

subtitles.original: なんか、いろんなみんながおしゃれな名前だったりとか、ストレートにファンネームをつけているみんなのメンバーシップを見て、
subtitles.english: Looking at everyone's memberships with stylish names or simple fan names,

subtitles.original: 「あ、THEかなたってダサかったんだ」と思いまして、
subtitles.english: I thought, "Oh, THE Kanata was tacky,"

subtitles.original: 現在のメンバーシップの名前は「へいみん」になっております。
subtitles.english: and now my membership name is "Heimin."

subtitles.original: よかった〜、そういうこと...
subtitles.english: Thank goodness, so that's it...

subtitles.original: 拍手すんな、よかったじゃない！残念だろ。
subtitles.english: Don't clap! It's not "thank goodness!" It's unfortunate.

subtitles.original: え、でも他にもちょっとかなた先輩といえばで、気になってることがあって。
subtitles.english: But there's something else about you, Kanata-senpai, that I'm curious about.

subtitles.original: かなた先輩、握力キャラというか、力がめっちゃあるみたいな感じで、自己紹介とかでも言ってると思うんですけど、あれは最初からではなかったんですか？
subtitles.english: You have this "grip strength" character, or like you're super strong, and I think you say it in your introductions, but was that not there from the start?

subtitles.original: いや、そうだね。自己紹介で言うようになったのは途中からね。
subtitles.english: No, that's right. I only started saying it in my introductions partway through.

subtitles.original: 昔から、本当に中学校とかの頃かな、握力が強くて。
subtitles.english: Since long ago, maybe around middle school, I had strong grip strength.

subtitles.original: 雑談の中でね、握力50kgあったんだよねーみたいなこと言ったりとか、
subtitles.english: I'd mention in streams like, "My grip strength was 50kg,"

subtitles.original: もう力強くて物が壊れちゃうって話をよくしてたら、なんかだんだんだんだん、わかんないけど「握力ゴリラキャラ」が定着していって。
subtitles.english: and if I often talked about being so strong I'd break things, then gradually, I don't know why, but the "Grip Strength Gorilla" character stuck.

subtitles.original: そんな僕がね、今までうっかり握りつぶしたものは、こちらです。
subtitles.english: Here are the things I've accidentally crushed.

subtitles.original: お寿司、マカロン、蒸したジャガイモ、お弁当のスプーン、コーヒーメーカー、キーボード、Switchのコントローラーなどなどですね。
subtitles.english: Sushi, macarons, steamed potatoes, lunchbox spoons, coffee makers, keyboards, Switch controllers, and so on.

subtitles.original: 多いなぁ。
subtitles.english: That's a lot.

subtitles.original: まあお寿司とかマカロンは、マカロン初めて食べた時に、優しく持とうと思ったんだけど、優しく持ったのに、ボロッボロになって...
subtitles.english: Well, for sushi or macarons... when I first ate a macaron, I thought I'd hold it gently, but even though I held it gently, it crumbled into pieces...

subtitles.original: そのエピソード大好き！かわいいな〜。
subtitles.english: I love that episode! So cute.

subtitles.original: あの、この中にある「お弁当のスプーン」ってやつなんですけど、これラミィの企画に前にかなたんが出てくれた時に、
subtitles.english: Um, about the "lunchbox spoon" on this list, when Kanata appeared in my project before,

subtitles.original: あの楽屋で出るお弁当かカレーだったんだけど、その時のスプーンを...
subtitles.english: it was either a lunchbox or curry we had in the dressing room, and the spoon then...

subtitles.original: バキって壊しちゃって。
subtitles.english: She snapped it.

subtitles.original: 折れたんだよ勝手に。普通に食べてるだけでスプーン壊してて。
subtitles.english: It just broke on its own. I was just eating normally and the spoon broke.

subtitles.original: そうなんです。そう、びっくりしましたね。
subtitles.english: Exactly. Yeah, I was surprised.

subtitles.original: 家ではあれですか、石のスプーンとか使ってる？
subtitles.english: Do you use like... stone spoons at home?

subtitles.original: 石のスプーン違いますよ。鉄すら壊す。
subtitles.english: Not stone spoons. I break even metal.

subtitles.original: ま、あのーちゃんと割り箸とかね、使いますけど、たまに割り箸も割れるけど。
subtitles.english: Well, I use disposable chopsticks properly, though sometimes they break too.

subtitles.original: そうですね、スプーン真っ二つ事件は楽屋でこれやったのは2回ありますね。
subtitles.english: Yeah, the "spoon snapped in half" incident happened twice in the dressing room.

subtitles.original: やば〜い！
subtitles.english: That's crazy!

subtitles.original: そしてちょっと前、配信の流れで握力を計測した結果がこちらでございます。ほお。
subtitles.english: And a little while ago, during a stream, we measured her grip strength, and here is the result. Oh.

subtitles.original: やばー！！えぇ〜〜！！！
subtitles.english: Crazy!! What?!!

subtitles.original: 55.9kgですね。
ゴリラやん！やばっ！
subtitles.english: She's a gorilla! Crazy!

subtitles.original: これは配信でお酒を珍しく飲んだ時に、酔ってリミッター外れてんじゃない？みたいなノリで、
subtitles.english: This was during a rare stream where I was drinking alcohol. In the heat of the moment, someone asked if my limiter was off because I was drunk.

subtitles.original: あるので握力計が僕のお家にあるので、測ってみたんですけど、55.9kgの新記録が出まして。
subtitles.english: I have a dynamometer at home, so I tried measuring, and I got a new record of 55.9kg.

subtitles.original: これはですね、レスリングの霊長類最強女子の吉田沙保里さんが、あるテレビ番組で計測したのが55kgだったと。
subtitles.english: This is... Yoshida Saori, the strongest primate woman in wrestling, measured 55kg on a TV show.

subtitles.original: おいおいおいおい、やべーよ、超えとるやん！それ超えてます！
subtitles.english: Wait, wait, wait, that's crazy, she surpassed her! I surpassed that!

subtitles.original: ちょっと握手してみます？
subtitles.english: Want to try shaking hands?

subtitles.original: いやいや、怖い怖い。
subtitles.english: No, no, that's scary.

subtitles.original: ラミィ、ラミィ...
subtitles.english: Lamy, Lamy...

subtitles.original: 前に握手したことあるんで。
subtitles.english: I've shaken hands before.

subtitles.original: あ、ね。新人ちゃん。
subtitles.english: Ah, right. Newbie.

subtitles.original: え、あの、リリカ握力7kgだったんですけど...
subtitles.english: Um, Ririka's grip strength was 7kg...

subtitles.original: 本気で来てください。壊す気で来てください。
subtitles.english: Please come at me for real. Come at me with the intent to break me.

subtitles.original: 8倍...いきますよ。8倍。
subtitles.english: 8 times... here I go. 8 times.

subtitles.original: もっと本気で来い！
subtitles.english: Come at me harder!

subtitles.original: あ〜〜〜〜！！う、腕がぁぁぁ！
subtitles.english: Aaaaah!! My... my arm!!

subtitles.original: 力の入れ方ってものを教えてやる。
subtitles.english: I'll teach you how to apply force.

subtitles.original: 怖い怖い、やめて！やめてください！
subtitles.english: Scary, scary, stop! Please stop!

subtitles.original: リリカ大丈夫？動く？
subtitles.english: Ririka, are you okay? Does it move?

subtitles.original: 大丈夫です。なめてました。
subtitles.english: I'm okay. I underestimated her.

subtitles.original: もうちょっとで壊すところでしたね。
subtitles.english: I was about to break it.

subtitles.original: 本当にホロメンは力の弱い子が多いので、僕がおかしいような雰囲気がよく漂いますが...
subtitles.english: There are really a lot of physically weak girls in Hololive, so there's often an atmosphere like I'm the weird one...

subtitles.original: おかしいけどな。
subtitles.english: You ARE weird though.

subtitles.original: ま、そしてそんなね、キャラとツッコミキャラ、大きなターニングポイントとなりました。
subtitles.english: Well, and those characters and my straight man character became a big turning point.

subtitles.original: このツッコミキャラなんですけど、当時マインクラフトのホロサバ内に「かなた城」、お城を建設していた僕なんですけど、
subtitles.english: About this straight man character, back then I was building "Kanata Castle" in the Hololive Minecraft server,

subtitles.original: それを見たフレア先輩が「かなた学校建設予定地」と看板を書きました。学校に見えたんですよね。
subtitles.english: and Flare-senpai saw it and wrote a sign saying "Kanata School Construction Site." It looked like a school to her.

subtitles.original: 「学校じゃねーからこれ！」と思わず言ったと。
subtitles.english: "It's not a school!!" I said instinctively.

subtitles.original: そしたらみこ先輩も来て「AO入学可能」と。で、学校いじりのボケが続いたので、「学校じゃねーよ！」とツッコミ続けたと。
subtitles.english: Then Miko-senpai came and wrote "AO admission possible." Since the school jokes continued, I kept retorting, "It's not a school!!"

subtitles.original: で、リスナーも喜んでくれまして、この時に気づいたことがあります。次のページ。
subtitles.english: And the listeners were happy too, and I realized something then. Next page.

subtitles.original: ホロライブにはボケが多い！
subtitles.english: There are a lot of funny people in Hololive!
